text: “ La La Land ” producer Jordan Horowitz holds up the winner card reading actual best picture winner “ Moonlight, ” with actor Warren Beatty and host Jimmy Kimmel. ( Kevin Winter / Getty Images ) There ’ s only one thing people of the Internet love more than an absolutely epic mistake on live television — conspiracy theories about how it could have happened. [ Oscars 2017 : 10 things you need to know, from the epic mix - up to Viola Davis ’ s speech ] A few hours after Faye Dunaway and Warren Beatty announced “ La La Land ” as best picture at the Academy Awards ( when the trophy actually belonged to “ Moonlight ” ), PricewaterhouseCoopers, the longtime accounting firm in charge of the Oscar ballots, took responsibility and released an apology statement.
